cards.name: Spined Fluke
cards.text:
When Spined Fluke enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Spined Fluke.
cards.flavor: Its spines are prized as writing quills by the priests of Gix.
cards.originalText:
When Spined Fluke comes into play, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Spined Fluke.

cards.name: Tainted Aether
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
cards.flavor: Gix despised the sylvan morass. The gouge that the portal had torn in the forest was the only pleasing sight.

rulings.text: If the creature changes controllers before this ability resolves, its new controller has to sacrifice something.
If more than one of these is on the battlefield, the controller sacrifices a creature for each one of these.
If the controller has no other lands or creatures on the battlefield, they must sacrifice the creature that just entered the battlefield.
Tainted Aether's controller is the one that controls its triggered ability, but the controller of the creature that entered the battlefield chooses what creature they sacrifice during resolution.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.

cards.name: Unnerve
cards.text: Each opponent discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me."
—Xantcha, to Gix

rulings.text: Players with less than 2 cards discard all they have.

cards.originalText: Each of your opponents chooses and discards two cards.

cards.name: Unworthy Dead
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Unworthy Dead.
cards.flavor:
"Great Yawgmoth moves across the seas of shard and bone and rust. We exalt him in life, in death, and in between."
—Phyrexian Scriptures
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Unworthy Dead.

cards.name: Vampiric Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying.
Whenever a creature successfully dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

cards.name: Vebulid
cards.text:
Vebulid enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Vebulid.
When Vebulid attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
Vebulid comes into play with one +1/+1 counter on it.
During your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Vebulid.
When Vebulid attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

cards.name: Victimize
cards.text: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: The priest cast Xantcha to the ground. "It is defective. We must scrap it."

rulings.text: You must choose two targets. You can't cast Victimize targeting only one creature card.
The creature you sacrifice isn't chosen until Victimize resolves. You can't return the creature you sacrifice because it will still be on the battlefield at the time targets are chosen.
As Victimize resolves, you must sacrifice a creature if able. You can't change your mind and choose not to sacrifice anything.

If one of the targeted creature cards is an illegal target (for instance, because it has left your graveyard before Victimize resolves), you'll still sacrifice a creature and put the other card onto the battlefield. If both are illegal targets, Victimize won't resolve. You won't sacrifice a creature.
Victimize can be used to put both parts of the B.F.M. onto the battlefield at once.

cards.originalText: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, put the two chosen creatures into play tapped.

cards.name: Vile Requiem
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Vile Requiem.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Vile Requiem: Destroy up to X target nonblack creatures, where X is the number of verse counters on Vile Requiem. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Vile Requiem.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Vile Requiem: Destroy up to X target nonblack creatures, where X is the number of verse counters on Vile Requiem. Those creatures cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Western Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Their weak laws. Their flawed systems. They inhibit the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall erase them."
—Oath of the West
cards.originalText: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.

cards.name: Witch Engine
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{T}: Add {B}{B}{B}{B}. Target opponent gains control of Witch Engine. (Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.)

rulings.text: Because the ability is targeted, it is not a mana ability. It can only be activated when you have priority, and goes on the stack like other non-mana abilities.

cards.originalText:
Swampwalk (If defending player controls a swamp, this creature is unblockable.)
{T}: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool. Target opponent gains control of Witch Engine. (Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Edict
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Phyrexia's purity permits no other."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast
cards.originalText: Whenever one of your opponents successfully casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Will
cards.text:
Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

rulings.text: The second ability creates a replacement effect. It applies to both costs and effects.
If you cast a Buyback spell, then there will be two effects trying to replace where the card goes. You get to choose if the Buyback returns the card to your hand or the card gets exiled.

If an effect asks you to discard a card, you can't "discard" something that is in your graveyard. Those cards are not in your hand. Thus, Cycling abilities of cards in the graveyard can't be activated.
It will exile itself since it goes to the graveyard after its effect starts.
If you play a card using Yawgmoth's Will and something triggers only when "cast from your hand", that something will not trigger. Such things trigger based on where the card came from.
To "play a card" is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.
You cannot Suspend a card from your graveyard, only your hand.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, you may play cards in your graveyard as though they were in your hand. Cards put into your graveyard this turn are removed from the game instead.

cards.name: Acidic Soil
cards.text: Acidic Soil deals damage to each player equal to the number of lands they control.
cards.flavor: Phyrexia had tried to take Urza's soul. He was relieved that Shiv tried to claim only his soles.

rulings.text: This counts the lands on resolution.

cards.originalText: Acidic Soil deals 1 damage to each player for each land he or she controls.

cards.name: Antagonism
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, Antagonism deals 2 damage to that player unless one of their opponents was dealt damage this turn.

rulings.text: It looks back over the entire turn even if this card was not on the battlefield at the time.

cards.originalText: During each player's discard phase, Antagonism deals 2 damage to that player unless one of his or her opponents was successfully dealt damage that turn.

cards.name: Arc Lightning
cards.text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
cards.flavor: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Arc Lightning has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some of the creatures are illegal targets as Arc Lightning tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies but no damage is dealt to the illegal targets. If all targets are illegal, Arc Lightning doesn't resolve.

cards.originalText: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Bedlam
cards.text: Creatures can't block.
cards.flavor: Sometimes quantity, in the absence of quality, is good enough.
cards.originalText: Creatures cannot block.

cards.name: Brand
cards.text:
Gain control of all permanents you own. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor:
"By this glyph I affirm your role."
—Urza, to Karn

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
A token's owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Gain control of all permanents you own.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Bravado
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"We drive the dragons from our home. Why should we fear you?"
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

rulings.text: The bonus is continuously calculated.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.

cards.name: Bulwark
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Bulwark deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: "It will be the goblin's first bath, and its last." —Fire Eye, viashino bey

rulings.text: Counts cards during resolution.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, Bulwark deals 1 damage to target opponent for each card in your hand greater than the number of cards in that player's hand.

cards.name: Crater Hellion
cards.text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Crater Hellion comes into play, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

cards.name: Destructive Urge
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor: Red sky at night, dragon's delight.

rulings.text: The ability has no effect if the player has no lands.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature successfully deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Disorder
cards.text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Then, just when the other guys were winnin', the sky threw up."
—Jula, goblin raider

rulings.text: Players take 0 or 2 damage. Disorder does not do 2 damage per creature to the player.

cards.originalText: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.

cards.name: Dromosaur
cards.text: Whenever Dromosaur blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They say dromosaurs are frightened of dogs, even little ones. There are no dogs in Shiv. Not even little ones.

rulings.text: If it manages to block or become blocked more than once in a turn, it can get the bonus twice.
Switching blockers will not re-trigger this since it only triggers on becoming blocked and switching does not unblock and reblock it.

cards.originalText: Whenever Dromosaur blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Electryte
cards.text: Whenever Electryte deals combat damage to defending player, it deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Shivan inhabitants are hardened to fire, so their predators have developed alternative weaponry.
cards.originalText: Whenever Electryte successfully deals combat damage to defending player, Electryte deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.

cards.name: Falter
cards.text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Like a sleeping dragon, Shiv stirs and groans at times.
cards.originalText: Creatures without flying cannot block this turn.

cards.name: Fault Line
cards.text: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
We live on the serpent's back.
—Viashino saying
cards.originalText: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Fiery Mantle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
When Fiery Mantle is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Fiery Mantle to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
When Fiery Mantle is put into a graveyard from play, return Fiery Mantle to owner's hand.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fire Ants
cards.text: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Visitors to Shiv fear the dragons, the goblins, or the viashino. Natives fear the ants.
cards.originalText: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.

cards.name: Gamble
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: When you've got nothing, you might as well trade it for something else.

rulings.text: You might end up discarding the card you searched for.
You put the card into your hand and discard a card at random all while Gamble is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then discard a card at random. Shuffle your library afterward.

cards.name: Goblin Cadets
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Cadets blocks or becomes blocked, target opponent gains control of it. (This removes Goblin Cadets from combat.)
cards.flavor: "If you kids don't stop that racket, I'm turning this expedition around right now!"
cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Cadets blocks or becomes blocked, target opponent gains control of it. (This removes Goblin Cadets from combat.)

cards.name: Goblin Lackey
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Lackey deals damage to a player, you may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: All bark, someone else's bite.

rulings.text: A Goblin permanent card is an artifact, creature, land, and/or enchantment card with the creature type "Goblin". Usually such cards will be creatures in addition to any other types, but they may be tribal instead. For example, you could put Boggart Shenanigans onto the battlefield with this effect.

cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Lackey successfully deals damage to a player, you may choose a Goblin card in your hand and put that Goblin into play.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: There's always room for one more.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card. If you do, reveal that card, put it into your hand, and shuffle your library afterward.

cards.name: Goblin Offensive
cards.text: Create X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: They certainly are.

rulings.text: The tokens are named "Goblin" and are of creature type "Goblin".

cards.originalText: Put X Goblin tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 red creatures.

cards.name: Goblin Patrol
cards.text: Echo {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor:
"Take the sharp metal stick and make a lotta holes."
—Jula, goblin raider
cards.originalText: Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor: He was proud to wear the lizard skin around his waist, just for the fun of annoying the enemy.
cards.originalText: Goblin Raider cannot block.

cards.name: Goblin Spelunkers
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor:
"It only short jump. You go first."
"AIIIEEEE!"
"Hmm . . . we go different way now."
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player controls a mountain, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Goblin War Buggy
cards.text:
Haste
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Goblin War Buggy is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Guma
cards.text: Protection from blue
cards.flavor: When the giant returned for the night, he found a dead merfolk on his pillow. Although he praised the little guma, he inwardly wondered where she had hid the head.
cards.originalText: Protection from blue

cards.name: Headlong Rush
cards.text: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A landslide of goblins poured toward the defenders—tumbling, rolling, and bouncing their way down the steep hillside.
cards.originalText: All attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Heat Ray
cards.text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.
cards.originalText: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.

cards.name: Jagged Lightning
cards.text: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.
cards.flavor: The pungent smell of roasting flesh made both mages realize they'd rather break for dinner than fight.
cards.originalText: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature and 3 damage to another target creature.

cards.name: Lay Waste
cards.text:
Destroy target land.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target land.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Lightning Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Echo {2}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{R}: Lightning Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying; echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
{R}: Lightning Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Meltdown
cards.text: Destroy each artifact with converted mana cost X or less.
cards.flavor: Catastrophes happened so often at the mana rig that the viashino language had a special word to describe them.
cards.originalText: Destroy each artifact with total casting cost X or less.

cards.name: Okk
cards.text:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.
cards.originalText:
Okk cannot attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk cannot block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

cards.name: Outmaneuver
cards.text: X target blocked creatures assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
cards.flavor:
"Push one goblin into sight, an' run a lot. That's tactics."
—Jula, goblin raider

rulings.text: If a creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
Creatures damage the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creatures are no longer there at that time.

cards.originalText: X target blocked creatures deal combat damage to defending player instead of to blocking creatures this turn.

cards.name: Rain of Salt
cards.text: Destroy two target lands.
cards.flavor: Here, rain does not wash the land; it desiccates it.

rulings.text: You must target two different lands. You can't choose to target just one.

cards.originalText: Destroy two target lands.

cards.name: Raze
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: The viashino believe that the oldest mountains hate everyone equally.
cards.originalText:
At the time you play Raze, sacrifice a land.
Destroy target land.

cards.name: Reflexes
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"Here's how ya win. Don't let the other guy hit back first."
—Jula, goblin raider
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gains first strike.

cards.name: Retromancer
cards.text: Whenever Retromancer becomes the target of a spell or ability, Retromancer deals 3 damage to that spell or ability's controller.
cards.flavor: "If one harm us, strike them in return. So sayeth the bey."
cards.originalText: Whenever Retromancer is the target of a spell or ability, Retromancer deals 3 damage to that spell or ability's controller.

cards.name: Rumbling Crescendo
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Rumbling Crescendo.
{R}, Sacrifice Rumbling Crescendo: Destroy up to X target lands, where X is the number of verse counters on Rumbling Crescendo.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Rumbling Crescendo.
{R}, Sacrifice Rumbling Crescendo: Destroy up to X target lands, where X is the number of verse counters on Rumbling Crescendo.

cards.name: Scald
cards.text: Whenever a player taps an Island for mana, Scald deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Shiv may be surrounded by water, but the mountains go far deeper."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey
cards.originalText: Whenever a player taps an island for mana, Scald deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Scoria Wurm
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Scoria Wurm to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Late at night, ululations echo from deep under Shiv, as the wurms sing of times older than humanity.
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Scoria Wurm to owner's hand.

cards.name: Scrap
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Shiv's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Wear the foe's form to best it in battle. So sayeth the bey."

rulings.text: Only Shiv's Embrace's controller (who is not necessarily the enchanted creature's controller) can activate its activated ability.

When Shiv's Embrace's activated ability resolves, the creature Shiv's Embrace is enchanting at that time will get +1/+0 (regardless of what creature Shiv's Embrace was enchanting when the ability was activated). If Shiv's Embrace has left the battlefield by then, the creature it was enchanting at the time it left the battlefield will get +1/+0.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shivan Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{R}: Shivan Hellkite deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: A dragon's scale can be carved into a mighty shield, provided you can procure a dragontooth to cut it.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}: Shivan Hellkite deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shivan Raptor
cards.text:
First strike, haste
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.originalText:
First strike; echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Shivan Raptor is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Shower of Sparks
cards.text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

rulings.text: If the creature leaves the battlefield before this resolves, it still damages the player.

cards.originalText: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Sneak Attack
cards.text: {R}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice the creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "Nothin' beat surprise—'cept rock."

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

You only sacrifice the creature if you still control it at end of turn. If that creature has left the battlefield, even if it came back, you don't sacrifice it. Likewise, if an opponent has gained control of it, it won't be sacrificed and will remain on the battlefield indefinitely.
Putting a card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to, even if you have one in your hand.

cards.originalText: {R}: Choose a creature card from your hand and put that creature into play. The creature is unaffected by summoning sickness. At end of turn, sacrifice the creature.

cards.name: Steam Blast
cards.text: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.
cards.originalText: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and player.

cards.name: Sulfuric Vapors
cards.text: If a red spell would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 1 to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: It was the dragons who first learned to chase their prey into the vapors before igniting them.

rulings.text: If the red spell damages more than one target, add 1 to each target.
The ability is a replacement effect which is applied when damage would become dealt.

cards.originalText: Whenever a red spell deals damage, it instead deals that amount of damage plus 1.

cards.name: Thundering Giant
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.
cards.originalText: Thundering Giant is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Torch Song
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Torch Song.
{2}{R}, Sacrifice Torch Song: It deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of verse counters on Torch Song.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Torch Song.
{2}{R}, Sacrifice Torch Song: Torch Song deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of verse counters on Torch Song.

cards.name: Viashino Outrider
cards.text: Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: "Give thy ration to thy mount, if the road be long. So sayeth the bey."
cards.originalText: Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Viashino Runner
cards.text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"It moved this way, an' that way, an' then before I could stick it, it jumped over my head an' was gone."
—Jula, goblin raider
cards.originalText: Viashino Runner cannot be blocked by only one creature.

cards.name: Viashino Sandswimmer
cards.text: {R}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Viashino Sandswimmer to its owner's hand. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Viashino Sandswimmer.
cards.flavor: Few swim in a place of such thirst.
cards.originalText: {R}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Viashino Sandswimmer to owner's hand. Otherwise, sacrifice Viashino Sandswimmer.

cards.name: Viashino Weaponsmith
cards.text: Whenever Viashino Weaponsmith becomes blocked by a creature, Viashino Weaponsmith gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Within the rig settlement, those who have mastered the making of weapons earn highest honor.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature blocks it, Viashino Weaponsmith gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vug Lizard
cards.text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
Echo {1}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Mountainwalk (If defending player controls a mountain, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"Shiv hatched from a shell of stone around a yolk of flame."
—Viashino myth
cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices four lands, then Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Abundance
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This replacement effect replaces the draw, so nothing that triggers on a draw will trigger.

If you use this on a multi-card draw, each replaced draw is handled separately. In other words, you reveal and then put on the bottom of the library for the first card, then do the same for the second, and so on. In a multi-card draw you do not have to choose how many of those draws will be replaced before you do any drawing or use of this card.
If no card of the chosen type is found before your library empties, you don't get a card, but you do get to order all the cards in your library any way you choose.

If your library is empty, Abundance can prevent you from losing the game for being unable to draw a card. If an effect or turn-based action would cause you to draw a card, you can replace that draw with Abundance's replacement effect. (It doesn't matter that you'd be unable to actually draw a card.) Since Abundance's effect has you put a card into your hand instead of drawing a card, you'll never be forced to draw a card with an empty library.

cards.originalText: Instead of drawing a card, you may choose land or nonland and reveal cards from your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Acridian
cards.text: Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: The elves of Argoth were trained to ride these creatures, even when their mounts traveled upside-down.
cards.originalText: Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)

{1}{G}: Regenerate Albino Troll.

Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Albino Troll.

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: If you're smaller than the anaconda, it considers you food. If you're larger than the anaconda, it considers you a lot of food.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player controls a swamp, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Argothian Elder
cards.text: {T}: Untap two target lands.
cards.flavor:
Sharpen your ears
—Elvish expression meaning "grow wiser"

rulings.text: The ability can target an already untapped land.
The ability must target two different lands. It can't be activated if there is just one land to target.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap two target lands.

cards.name: Argothian Enchantress
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.

rulings.text: Argothian Enchantress's last ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.
If the enchantment spell is countered, Argothian Enchantress's last ability still resolves and causes you to draw a card.
Enchantments put onto the battlefield without being cast won't cause Argothian Enchantress's last ability to trigger.

cards.originalText:
Argothian Enchantress cannot be the target of spells or abilities.
Whenever you successfully cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.

cards.name: Argothian Swine
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: In Argoth, the shortest path between two points is the one the swine make.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Argothian Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Argothian Wurm enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice a land. If a player does, put Argothian Wurm on top of its owner's library.

rulings.text: When Argothian Wurm enters the battlefield, first the active player gets the option to sacrifice a land. If they decline, the next player in turn order gets the option. If a player elects to sacrifice a land, Argothian Wurm is put on top of its owner's library, but then all remaining players still get the option. If all players decline, then nothing happens and Argothian Wurm stays on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When Argothian Wurm comes into play, any player may sacrifice a land to put Argothian Wurm on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
cards.flavor:
"Braid her branches, life fulfilling
Goddess loving, Goddess killing."
—Citanul chant
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of forests you control.

cards.name: Blanchwood Treefolk
cards.flavor: The massive Argivian attack on their rooted kindred was a declaration of war to the treefolk.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor:
"How could you not hear it approach? It's a hippo!"
—Argivian commander
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player controls an island, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Carpet of Flowers
cards.text: At the beginning of each of your main phases, if you haven't added mana with this ability this turn, you may add X mana of any one color, where X is the number of Islands target opponent controls.

rulings.text: You can target a different opponent each turn.
The ability is not a mana ability.

cards.originalText: During your main phase, you may add up to X mana of one color to your mana pool, where X is the number of islands target opponent controls.

cards.name: Cave Tiger
cards.text: Whenever Cave Tiger becomes blocked by a creature, Cave Tiger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The druids found a haven in the cool limestone tunnels beneath Argoth. The invaders found only tigers.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature blocks it, Cave Tiger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Child of Gaea
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Child of Gaea unless you pay {G}{G}.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Child of Gaea.

rulings.text: You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice Child of Gaea. You can choose to not pay even if you no longer control Child of Gaea on resolution.
If you do choose not to pay, but no longer control Child of Gaea, you cannot sacrifice. It will remain on the battlefield under its current controller's control.

cards.originalText:
Trample
During your upkeep, pay {G}{G} or sacrifice Child of Gaea.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Child of Gaea.

cards.name: Citanul Hierophants
cards.text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Add {G}."
cards.flavor: From deep in the caves beneath the forest, the hierophants planned the druids' raids against the enemy.
cards.originalText: Each creature you control gains "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source."

Trample
Echo {1}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor:
Mother, sleep / Dream our lives
Our roots your soul / Our leaves your bed.

cards.name: Crosswinds
cards.text: Creatures with flying get -2/-0.
cards.flavor: Harbin's ornithopter had been trapped for two days within the currents of the storm. When the skies cleared, all he could see was a horizon of trees.
cards.originalText: All creatures with flying get -2/-0.

cards.name: Elvish Herder
cards.text: {G}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Before Urza and Mishra came to Argoth, the herders prevented their creatures from stampeding. During the war, they encouraged it.
cards.originalText: {G}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Elvish Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Endless Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Endless Wurm unless you sacrifice an enchantment.
cards.flavor: Ages ago, a party of elves took cover to let one pass. They're still waiting.

rulings.text: You choose whether to sacrifice an enchantment or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not sacrifice an enchantment if you no longer control this card on resolution.

cards.originalText:
Trample

cards.name: Exploration
cards.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
cards.flavor: The first explorers found Argoth a storehouse of natural wealth—towering forests grown over rich veins of ore.
cards.originalText: You may play an additional land each turn.

cards.name: Fecundity
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may draw a card.

cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: The forest was too lush for the brothers to despoil—almost.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, it produces an additional one mana of any color.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate enchanted creature.
When Fortitude is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Fortitude to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
When Fortitude is put into a graveyard from play, return Fortitude to owner's hand.
Sacrifice a forest: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Gaea's Bounty
cards.text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The forest grew back so quickly that lumbering machines were suspended in the treetops.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two forest cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.

cards.name: Gaea's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has trample.
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: The forest rose to the battle, not to save the people but to save itself.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample.
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Gorilla Warrior
cards.flavor: The gorilla beat its chest and threw great handfuls of leaves into the air. It howled challenge and showed its teeth. The mechanical soldier, not understanding, simply killed it.

cards.name: Greater Good
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.
cards.flavor:
"We have more sprouts than they have hands."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

rulings.text: You must discard three cards regardless of how many cards you drew. If you have less than three cards in hand, you discard your hand.
You draw cards equal to the creature's power when you sacrificed it. This includes any bonuses from effects like Giant Growth.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then choose and discard three cards.

cards.name: Greener Pastures
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, the player creates a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

rulings.text: The ability does not trigger unless the player has more lands at the beginning of upkeep. This is checked again on resolution, and if the player does not still have more lands, no token is generated.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than any other, the player puts a Saproling token into play under his or her control. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
